      This method is used to evaluate a given relational expression Operators supported :- For string comparison --> "=","!=" For int comparison --> ">","<","<=",">=","==","<>"

      This is a generic method to evaluate all aggregate functions Functions supported :-sum(), min(), max(), count() and average()

      This method returns the database connection
      private void createMethodToGetSalesData(java.io.FileWriter fw, java.util.List<java.lang.String> query)
      This method is used to get all the data from sales table and store it in the List of Sales object in memory
      private void createMethodToPopulateMFStructure(java.io.FileWriter fw)
      This method populates the MF structure from the list of sales record based on the where clause condition and grouping variables.
      private void createMethodToProcessHavingClause(java.io.FileWriter fw)
      This method parses the having clause expression and filters the records from MF Structure based in this expression Format of having clause expression: {left condition}[boolean operator][right condition] Format of condition: {left operand,operator,right operand} Having clause example: {avg_quant_NY,>,avg_quant_CT} [&&] {avg_quant_NY,>,avg_quant_NJ}
      private void createMethodToProcessPredicates(java.io.FileWriter fw)
      This method does the following: Step 1: Parses the predicate expression Step 2: Evaluate each tuple record for the given predicate expression against the list of MF structure records Format of the predicate clause expression:- Predicate clause for each grouping variables are separated by ",".

      • createMethodToEvaluateExpression

        private void createMethodToEvaluateExpression(java.io.FileWriter fw)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to evaluate a given relational expression Operators supported :- For string comparison --> "=","!=" For int comparison --> ">","<","<=",">=","==","<>"

      • createMethodToProcessHavingClause

        private void createMethodToProcessHavingClause(java.io.FileWriter fw)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        This method parses the having clause expression and filters the records from MF Structure based in this expression Format of having clause expression: {left condition}[boolean operator][right condition] Format of condition: {left operand,operator,right operand} Having clause example: {avg_quant_NY,>,avg_quant_CT} [&&] {avg_quant_NY,>,avg_quant_NJ}
        Parameters:
        fw - Filewriter object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IO exception

      • createMethodToProcessPredicates

        private void createMethodToProcessPredicates(java.io.FileWriter fw)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        This method does the following: Step 1: Parses the predicate expression Step 2: Evaluate each tuple record for the given predicate expression against the list of MF structure records Format of the predicate clause expression:- Predicate clause for each grouping variables are separated by ",". Multiple conditions within each clause are separated by ":". Where clause condition expression. Format of condition expression: {left operand}[operator]{right operand} Expression format: if expression represents MF structure column : {MF..} e.g. {MF.cust.avg_quant_NY} if expression represents tuple column : {} e.g. {cust} Full predicate clause expression example: {MF.cust.avg_quant_NY}[=]{cust}:{state}[=]{NY},{MF.cust.avg_quant_CT}[=]{cust}:{state}[=]{CT},{MF.cust.avg_quant_NJ}[=]{cust}:{state}[=]{NJ},{year}[==]{1997}
        Parameters:
        fw - Filewriter object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IO exception

      • createMainMethod

        private void createMainMethod(java.io.FileWriter fw,
                              int count,
                              boolean isGroupZeroPresent,
                              java.lang.String selectAttb,
                              java.lang.String groupingAttb,
                              java.lang.String predicateClauseStr,
                              int noOfGrpVariables,
                              java.lang.String aggregrateFunctions,
                              java.lang.String havingClause)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Creates the main method for the generated code which initiates the query engine execution.
        Parameters:
        fw - Filewriter object
        count - Input query count
        isGroupZeroPresent - Boolean flag to indicate if grouping variable zero is present.
        selectAttb - Select attributes.
        groupingAttb - Grouping attributes.
        predicateClauseStr - Predicate clause for all grouping variables.
        noOfGrpVariables - No of grouping variables.
        aggregrateFunctions - Aggregate functions.
        havingClause - Having clause expression.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - throws IO exception

        Parameters:
        args - main method arguments
